alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 26 at 7:59PM MDT until March 28 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MDT /1 AM CDT/ TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MDT /1 AM CDT/ MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Northwest winds gusting up to 35 mph favor Yuma and Kit Carson counties. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...From midnight MDT /1 AM CDT/ tonight to midnight MDT /1 AM CDT/ Monday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Blowing snow will reduce visibilities, be aware if driving. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 35 mph causing blowing snow resulting in reduction of visibility especially across Yuma and Kit Carson counties in eastern Colorado. The best potential for blowing snow is late Monday morning into the afternoon hours. Snow accumulation may vary considerably county to county and over short distances in any one specific county.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling, especially along Interstate 70. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
